channel.title: World & Nation
channel.description: Nation and World articles from the Los Angeles Times.

item.title: Summer of 2023 was hottest in 2,000 years, study finds
item.dc:creator: Hayley Smith
item.description: 2023 marked the hottest summer in the Northern Hemisphere in the last 2,000 years, according to a new study.
item.content:encoded: 2023 marked the hottest summer in the Northern Hemisphere in the last 2,000 years, according to a new study.

item.title: Planned Parenthood announces latest outside spending plan in California congressional races
item.dc:creator: Seema Mehta
item.description: California could determine control of Congress, which is why Super PACs on both sides of the aisle plan to spend millions of dollars here.
item.content:encoded: California could determine control of Congress, which is why Super PACs on both sides of the aisle plan to spend millions of dollars here.

item.title: Goldberg: Biden still trails Trump in the polls. His problem goes beyond inflation, Gaza and age
item.dc:creator: Jonah Goldberg
item.description: The president has tried to leverage abortion rights, tout progress on the economy and adjust his Israel policy. What he can't change are the "vibes."
item.content:encoded: The president has tried to leverage abortion rights, tout progress on the economy and adjust his Israel policy. What he can't change are the "vibes."

item.title: Biden, Trump head to Southern California in June for big-dollar fundraisers
item.dc:creator: Seema Mehta
item.description: Trump will headline Beverly Hills and Newport Beach events. Biden will attend a downtown L.A. fundraiser with former President Obama, actors George Clooney and Julia Roberts.
item.content:encoded: Trump will headline Beverly Hills and Newport Beach events. Biden will attend a downtown L.A. fundraiser with former President Obama, actors George Clooney and Julia Roberts.

media:content.media:title: 1360493-me-laphonza-butler30-mam.jpg
media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA-OCTOBER 13, 2023:George Clooney, left, actor and founder of the Roybal School of Film and Television Production Magnet in downtown Los Angeles, and Don Cheadle, actor and Royal Advisory Board Member, talk to the media during a celebration of the launch of the 2nd year of the Magnet School. (Mel Melcon/Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Litman: Michael Cohen is testifying against Trump. Here's what prosecutors need from him
item.dc:creator: Harry Litman
item.description: The key witness in the New York hush money trial said the then-candidate told him to do what he had to do to suppress Stormy Daniels' story of a liaison with him.
item.content:encoded: The key witness in the New York hush money trial said the then-candidate told him to do what he had to do to suppress Stormy Daniels' story of a liaison with him.

item.title: Supreme Court denies California's plea for immunity for COVID-19 deaths at San Quentin
item.dc:creator: David G. Savage
item.description: The Supreme Court refuses to shield California prison officials who transferred COVID-infected inmates to San Quentin, setting off a deadly outbreak.
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court refuses to shield California prison officials who transferred COVID-infected inmates to San Quentin, setting off a deadly outbreak.

item.title: Column: A lesson from Presidents Biden and Trump — the new normal is nonstop crises
item.dc:creator: Doyle McManus
item.description: Trump is trying to blame Biden for anything that goes wrong — illegal immigration, Gaza and Ukraine wars, inflation. It's the new burden of incumbency.
item.content:encoded: Trump is trying to blame Biden for anything that goes wrong — illegal immigration, Gaza and Ukraine wars, inflation. It's the new burden of incumbency.

item.title: Despite H5N1 bird flu outbreaks in dairy cattle, raw milk enthusiasts are uncowed
item.dc:creator: Susanne Rust
item.description: Despite warnings of H5N1 bird flu outbreaks among dairy cattle, raw milk enthusiasts say they will continue to drink unpasteurized milk.
item.content:encoded: Despite warnings of H5N1 bird flu outbreaks among dairy cattle, raw milk enthusiasts say they will continue to drink unpasteurized milk.

media:content.media:title: Holstein cows at Riverview Dairy
media:content.media:description: Holstein cows at Riverview Dairy in Pixley, California, on March 12, 2020. The liquid part of their manure is directed into a nearby anaerobic digester, which captures methane that would otherwise be emitted into the atmosphere.

item.title: Calmes: Our elections have integrity. These politicians do not
item.dc:creator: Jackie Calmes
item.description: Of all Trump's shattered norms, the refusal to commit to accept election results is the most corrosive to American democracy.
item.content:encoded: Of all Trump's shattered norms, the refusal to commit to accept election results is the most corrosive to American democracy.

item.title: Arizona's economy is booming. But Biden struggles to reap benefits from voters
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Oreskes
item.description: President Biden's push to expand semiconductor and green technology manufacturing has poured billions into battleground states like Arizona.
item.content:encoded: President Biden's push to expand semiconductor and green technology manufacturing has poured billions into battleground states like Arizona.

item.title: Like water sloshing in a giant bathtub, El Niño begins an inevitable retreat
item.dc:creator: Ned Kleiner
item.description: Think of the Pacific Ocean like one enormous bathtub, and El Niño like a wave of warm water sloshing from one end of the bathtub to another.
item.content:encoded: Think of the Pacific Ocean like one enormous bathtub, and El Niño like a wave of warm water sloshing from one end of the bathtub to another.

media:content.media:title: 2449286_me_el_nino_storm08_ALS.JPG
media:content.media:description: VENTURA, CA - JANUARY 07, 2016 - Forceful and beautiful waves crash into the sea walls of homes at Mondo's Beach under the mountains of the recent Solimar fire at high tide sunrise west of Ventura Thursday morning January 07, 2016 as El Nino storms move through Southern California with more rain and heavy surf. (Al Seib / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Biden raises millions on West Coast as he says his campaign is underestimated
item.dc:creator: Seema Mehta
item.description: President Biden raised millions of dollars for his reelection bid in Silicon Valley on Friday as he poked at former President Trump and argued that his campaign was being underestimated.
item.content:encoded: President Biden raised millions of dollars for his reelection bid in Silicon Valley on Friday as he poked at former President Trump and argued that his campaign was being underestimated.

item.title: Russia tries to breach Ukraine's defenses in the Kharkiv region. Feint, or all-out assault?
item.dc:creator: Laura King
item.description: Ukraine is trying to determine if Russia's ground attack in Kharkiv is opening a new war front — or meant to divert overstretched Ukrainian troops?
item.content:encoded: Ukraine is trying to determine if Russia's ground attack in Kharkiv is opening a new war front — or meant to divert overstretched Ukrainian troops?

item.title: Solar storm heading to Earth could disrupt communications and bring northern lights to California
item.dc:creator: Corinne Purtill
item.description: A geomagnetic storm is heading to Earth, with the possibility to disrupt GPS and communications. It could also bring the northern lights to Northern California, much farther south than is typical.
item.content:encoded: A geomagnetic storm is heading to Earth, with the possibility to disrupt GPS and communications. It could also bring the northern lights to Northern California, much farther south than is typical.

item.title: Granderson: Biden is right to nudge Israel toward protecting civilians in Rafah
item.dc:creator: LZ Granderson
item.description: Pausing a shipment of weapons sends a message that the U.S. values human life.
item.content:encoded: Pausing a shipment of weapons sends a message that the U.S. values human life.

item.title: Facing a 'national emergency,' South Korea president announces new ministry to boost birth rate
item.dc:creator: Max Kim
item.description: If South Korea doesn't reverse its current low birth rate, the country's population will drop dramatically in coming decades.
item.content:encoded: If South Korea doesn't reverse its current low birth rate, the country's population will drop dramatically in coming decades.

item.title: Jewish families say anti-Israel messaging in Bay Area classrooms is making schools unsafe
item.dc:creator: Hannah Wiley
item.description: Jewish families across the Bay Area say they've been disturbed by the anti-Israel rhetoric tolerated in K-12 classrooms — and the failure to understand why their kids feel attacked and isolated.
item.content:encoded: Jewish families across the Bay Area say they've been disturbed by the anti-Israel rhetoric tolerated in K-12 classrooms — and the failure to understand why their kids feel attacked and isolated.

media:content.media:description: WESTWOOD, CA - APRIL 28: Israeli flags wave in the air during a demonstration in support of Israel at UCLA on Sunday, April 28, 2024 in Westwood, CA. (Robert Gauthier / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Experts blast CDC over failure to test sewage for signs of H5N1 bird flu virus
item.dc:creator: Susanne Rust
item.description: As officials attempt to determine the extent of bird flu outbreaks among dairy herds, some experts are urging that wastewater surveillance begin immediately.
item.content:encoded: As officials attempt to determine the extent of bird flu outbreaks among dairy herds, some experts are urging that wastewater surveillance begin immediately.

item.title: Hollywood mega-donor Haim Saban slams Biden's decision to halt weapons shipment to Israel
item.dc:creator: Seema Mehta
item.description: Haim Saban was criticized by Muslim American leaders over his remarks that "Jewish voters who care about Israel" outnumber "Muslim voters who care about Hamas."
item.content:encoded: Haim Saban was criticized by Muslim American leaders over his remarks that "Jewish voters who care about Israel" outnumber "Muslim voters who care about Hamas."

item.title: California AG plans how to thwart Trump with lawsuits if he wins another term
item.dc:creator: Noah Bierman, David G. Savage
item.description: A second Trump term would likely invite lawsuits over environmental, immigration and abortion laws, as well as LGBTQ+ rights, California Atty. Gen. Rob Bonta said.
item.content:encoded: A second Trump term would likely invite lawsuits over environmental, immigration and abortion laws, as well as LGBTQ+ rights, California Atty. Gen. Rob Bonta said.

media:content.media:title: 1321797-la-me-military-consumer-month-rob-bonta-02-fo.jpg
media:content.media:description: Los Angeles, CA - July 13: California Attorney General Rob Bonta speaks during a news conference in recognition of Military Consumer Month at Patriotic Hall on Thursday, July 13, 2023, in Los Angeles, CA. He is discussing ways to help protect California service members, veterans, and their family members from scams and fraud. (Francine Orr / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Biden administration wants to speed up deportation for some migrants. How will it work?
item.dc:creator: Andrea Castillo
item.description: The change comes as the White House and Democrats play offense on the border and immigration, one of the top issues ahead of the presidential election.
item.content:encoded: The change comes as the White House and Democrats play offense on the border and immigration, one of the top issues ahead of the presidential election.

item.title: Miss Teen USA resigns — days after Miss USA does the same — amid 'workplace toxicity' allegation
item.dc:creator: Nardine Saad
item.description: Days after Miss USA resigned, Miss Teen USA UmaSofia Srivastava also quits, saying that her personal values 'no longer fully align' with Miss USA Organization.
item.content:encoded: Days after Miss USA resigned, Miss Teen USA UmaSofia Srivastava also quits, saying that her personal values 'no longer fully align' with Miss USA Organization.

item.title: We all have a worm in our brain: Welcome to 2024
item.dc:creator: Lorraine Ali
item.description: The revelation that presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. had a parasite that ate parts of his brain is just the latest bizarre news this election cycle.
item.content:encoded: The revelation that presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. had a parasite that ate parts of his brain is just the latest bizarre news this election cycle.

media:content.media:title: 1426446-me-0330-rfk-cesar-chavez-gem-005.jpg
media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - MARCH 30, 2024 - - Independent Presidential Candidate Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. speaks to supporters while hosting Cesar Chavez Day at the iconic Old Ticket Concourse at Union Station in Los Angeles on March 30, 2024. This event, on Chavez's birthday holiday weekend, included remarks by Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., music by the all-female mariachi group Las Colibri and remarks from Bishop Juan Carlos Mendez. Kennedy Jr. has used Cesar Chavez's name and image in his campaign for president, eliciting outrage from Chavez family members. (Genaro Molina/Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Supreme Court rules owners of seized cars are not entitled to immediate hearing
item.dc:creator: David G. Savage
item.description: The Supreme Court refuses to tighten the rules when police seize cars.
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court refuses to tighten the rules when police seize cars.

item.title: Calmes: Trump promises to subvert the law — first by freeing the Jan. 6 criminals
item.dc:creator: Jackie Calmes
item.description: The U.S. president is sworn to uphold the law, but presidential candidate Donald Trump keeps pledging to break it. We should believe him.

item.title: Mistrust, fights and blood sport: How COVID-19 trauma is shaping the 2024 election
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Fleishman
item.description: Americans want to forget about COVID-19, but fallout from the pandemic is shaping voter attitudes about the nation's economy and divisive politics heading into a Biden-Trump rematch.
item.content:encoded: Americans want to forget about COVID-19, but fallout from the pandemic is shaping voter attitudes about the nation's economy and divisive politics heading into a Biden-Trump rematch.

media:content.media:description: During the global coronavirus pandemic ICU nurses Fernando Fernadez, 27, left, Amanda Hamilton, 29, middle, and , Luz Escabar, right, are working on a covid19 patient in the ICU unit at Martin Luther King, Jr., Community Hospital on Thursday, May 6, 2020 in the Willowbrook neighborhood located in South Los Angeles, CA. (Francine Orr / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Migrants play 'the asylum lottery' on controversial U.S. government app
item.dc:creator: Patrick J. McDonnell
item.description: Depending on whom you ask, the federal immigration app CBP One is a solution to the border crisis, a human rights violation or a ploy to let anyone into the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Depending on whom you ask, the federal immigration app CBP One is a solution to the border crisis, a human rights violation or a ploy to let anyone into the U.S.

media:content.media:description: Tijuana, Mexico, Thursday, April 25, 2024 - Hundreds of asylum seekers who used a CBP phone app to make an appointment, are led to their interviews with U.S. customs agents at the San Ysidro Border Crossing. (Robert Gauthier/Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Chinese President Xi's trip to Europe: 'Charm offensive' or canny bid to divide the West?
item.dc:creator: Laura King
item.description: Touring Europe for the first time in five years, Chinese President Xi has sought to both woo and divide. Ukraine and trade are wedge issues for China.
item.content:encoded: Touring Europe for the first time in five years, Chinese President Xi has sought to both woo and divide. Ukraine and trade are wedge issues for China.

item.title: Dick Rutan, co-pilot of around-the-world flight, dies at 85
item.dc:creator: Laurence Darmiento
item.description: Dick Rutan co-piloted the Voyager around the world in 1986, taking off from and landing at Edwards Air Force Base without stopping in one of aviation's greatest feats.
item.content:encoded: Dick Rutan co-piloted the Voyager around the world in 1986, taking off from and landing at Edwards Air Force Base without stopping in one of aviation's greatest feats.

item.title: Q&A: Parent burnout is real. Here's what you can do about it
item.dc:creator: Karen Kaplan
item.description: In a nationwide survey of parents, 57% said they struggled with stress, exhaustion and feeling overwhelmed. When parents suffer burnout, children may suffer too.
item.content:encoded: In a nationwide survey of parents, 57% said they struggled with stress, exhaustion and feeling overwhelmed. When parents suffer burnout, children may suffer too.

item.title: Warmest April on record extends planet's hot streak to 11 months
item.dc:creator: Hayley Smith

item.content:encoded: With an average surface temperature of 59.05 degrees, the month was about 0.25 of a degree warmer than the previous hottest April, in 2016.

item.title: Supreme Court poised to enter debate over transgender care for minors

item.content:encoded: Supreme Court may be about to decide whether to hear a dispute over restrictions on transgender care for minors, potentially impacting laws in nearly half of states.

item.title: Goldberg: What happened to the Republican war on 'woke' — and what we should have learned from it

item.content:encoded: Democrats' far-left excesses are collapsing under their own weight. Ron DeSantis, Donald Trump and other culture warriors had little to do with it.

item.title: How a drilling project and Israel-Hamas overshadow Biden's climate record for young voters

item.content:encoded: Many young voters don't know much about Biden's climate record. And many activists who helped fuel his 2020 victory are angry about Gaza and a drilling project.

item.title: This tiny apartment costs $7 a month. Scoring one is like winning the lottery

item.content:encoded: In one of the worst housing markets in the world, these apartments are $7 a month.

media:content.media:title: 1444418-la-fg-seoul-apartments-007-jc.jpg
media:content.media:description: Seoul, South Korea-April 30, 2024-Kim Do-yeon, a new tenant for the 7-dollar apartment for youths, stands inside her room in Dongjak District in Seoul, South Korea. Government officials prepare for the gourds in front of the tenants for them to break them to ward off the evil spirit at the opening ceremony of the 7-dollar apartment for youths in Dongjak District in Seoul, South Korea. (Jean Chung / For The Times)

media:content.media:description: Haitian migrants camp out at the Giordano Bruno plaza in Mexico City, Thursday, May 18, 2023. The group was staying at a shelter in Mexico City on their way north but were forced to make camp at the park after the shelter closed. (AP Photo/Marco Ugarte)

item.title: Boeing Starliner launch delayed until at least May 17 due to faulty valve
item.dc:creator: Laurence Darmiento
item.description: The launch of Boeing's Starliner capsule with two astronauts aboard to the International Space Station was delayed until at least next week after NASA decided to replace a faulty valve on the Atlas V rocket that would blast it into space.
item.content:encoded: The launch of Boeing's Starliner capsule with two astronauts aboard to the International Space Station was delayed until at least next week after NASA decided to replace a faulty valve on the Atlas V rocket that would blast it into space.

item.description: The president's policies suggest common cause with the "Yes in My Backyard" movement. He and other Democrats can improve their election prospects by addressing economic anxiety.
item.content:encoded: The president's policies suggest common cause with the "Yes in My Backyard" movement. He and other Democrats can improve their election prospects by addressing economic anxiety.

item.title: RFK Jr. could be a spoiler in November. But will it help Biden or Trump?
item.dc:creator: Seema Mehta
item.description: RFK Jr., who recently qualified for the California ballot as a member of the American Independent Party, could draw votes from Biden and Trump.
item.content:encoded: RFK Jr., who recently qualified for the California ballot as a member of the American Independent Party, could draw votes from Biden and Trump.

item.title: Maui looks to cut back on Airbnbs, vacation rentals as early as next summer
item.dc:creator: Grace Toohey
item.description: Facing a worsening housing crisis, the Hawaii Legislature overwhelmingly passed a measure that allows counties to phase out short-term rentals. Maui almost immediately announced efforts to transition vacation rental apartments into long-term housing.
item.content:encoded: Facing a worsening housing crisis, the Hawaii Legislature overwhelmingly passed a measure that allows counties to phase out short-term rentals. Maui almost immediately announced efforts to transition vacation rental apartments into long-term housing.

item.title: Ex-Dodger Jayson Werth has a horse in the Kentucky Derby. It took him just two years
item.dc:creator: Steve Henson
item.description: Best remembered for shaking up MLB with a $126-million deal, Jayson Werth invested in race horses two years ago and improbably has Dornoch in the Kentucky Derby.
item.content:encoded: Best remembered for shaking up MLB with a $126-million deal, Jayson Werth invested in race horses two years ago and improbably has Dornoch in the Kentucky Derby.

item.title: Litman: The Trump prosecution has a Michael Cohen problem — and a plan to solve it
item.dc:creator: Harry Litman
item.description: The convicted former fixer will figure prominently in the New York hush money trial. His credibility issues give the defense plenty to work with.
item.content:encoded: The convicted former fixer will figure prominently in the New York hush money trial. His credibility issues give the defense plenty to work with.

item.title: Gazans thank U.S. campus protesters. Israel condemns what it sees as 'Nazi-like behavior'
item.dc:creator: Nabih Bulos
item.description: People across Gaza sent thanks to students protesting on U.S. campuses against Israel; Israeli leaders characterized the demonstrators as 'pro-Palestinian mobs.'
item.content:encoded: People across Gaza sent thanks to students protesting on U.S. campuses against Israel; Israeli leaders characterized the demonstrators as 'pro-Palestinian mobs.'

item.title: With oil funds and Formula One, Saudi Arabia steamrolls its way onto sports' hallowed grounds
item.dc:creator: Nabih Bulos
item.description: Saudi Arabia's oil riches have rocked soccer, golf, even esports, and the autocratic kingdom is expanding in Formula One car racing. What's behind the push?
item.content:encoded: Saudi Arabia's oil riches have rocked soccer, golf, even esports, and the autocratic kingdom is expanding in Formula One car racing. What's behind the push?

item.title: Meta now has an AI chatbot. Experts say get ready for more AI-powered social media
item.dc:creator: Jireh Deng
item.description: Artificial intelligence experts said social media users can expect to see more of chatbots and other AI technology influencing their experience — for better or possibly worse.
item.content:encoded: Artificial intelligence experts said social media users can expect to see more of chatbots and other AI technology influencing their experience — for better or possibly worse.

item.title: Mace, green lasers, screeching soundtracks: Inside the UCLA encampment on a night of violence
item.dc:creator: Summer Lin, Ashley Ahn, Ruben Vives, Brittny Mejia, Hailey Branson-Potts
item.description: Even before Tuesday night's bloody physical altercations, protesters occupying a pro-Palestinian encampment at UCLA said counterdemonstrators have assaulted them nightly with a jarring barrage of light and sound.

item.title: Prince William shares positive health update about Kate Middleton amid cancer battle
item.dc:creator: Nardine Saad
item.description: Prince William said that his wife Catherine and their children are 'all doing well' months after the princess revealed that she has an undisclosed form of cancer.
item.content:encoded: Prince William said that his wife Catherine and their children are 'all doing well' months after the princess revealed that she has an undisclosed form of cancer.

item.title: Arizona Senate votes to repeal 1864 abortion law, leaving state with 15-week ban
item.dc:creator: Faith E. Pinho
item.description: Arizona senators have voted to repeal the 1864 abortion law after weeks of turmoil in the state.
item.content:encoded: Arizona senators have voted to repeal the 1864 abortion law after weeks of turmoil in the state.

item.title: On global stage, 'RuPaul's Drag Race' Taiwanese winner says the word China hates
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Yang

item.content:encoded: Taiwan is celebrating the latest winner of 'RuPaul's Drag Race,' Nymphia Wind, after she called the island a country.

item.title: As tensions grow, more Americans see China as an enemy

item.description: A growing number of Americans consider China an enemy whose influence should be contained, a Pew Research study finds
item.content:encoded: A growing number of Americans consider China an enemy whose influence should be contained, a Pew Research study finds

item.title: Inside the far-right plan to use civil rights law to disrupt the 2024 election

item.title: This artist always rejected gentrification. But homelessness pushed him to 'the other end'
item.dc:creator: Noah Bierman
item.description: Artist Joel Coplin has a complicated relationship with homeless people. He sued Phoenix to clear an encampment. But he also befriended them and found inspiration for his art.
item.content:encoded: Artist Joel Coplin has a complicated relationship with homeless people. He sued Phoenix to clear an encampment. But he also befriended them and found inspiration for his art.

media:content.media:title: 1433894-la-pol-he-painted-his-homeless-neighbors-then-sued-to-have-them-removed-03-gmf.jpg
media:content.media:description: PHOENIX, AZ - APRIL 16, 2024: Much of Joel Coplin's artwork depicts real scenes of homeless life in his neighborhood on April 16, 2024 in Phoenix, Arizona. More than 14,000 Arizonans are homeless on a given night. He has helped the homeless with food and money and has been a plaintiff in a lawsuit that has forced the city to clear the encampments.(Gina Ferazzi / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Lauren Boebert is her own best asset — and worst enemy — as she fights to stay in Congress
item.dc:creator: Mark Z. Barabak
item.description: In a new district, the fiery Colorado congresswoman enjoys a solid base among the GOP's MAGA wing. But some are put off by her indiscretions and messy personal life.
item.content:encoded: In a new district, the fiery Colorado congresswoman enjoys a solid base among the GOP's MAGA wing. But some are put off by her indiscretions and messy personal life.

item.title: Litman: Donald Trump was just fined for contempt of court. Could he go to jail next time?

item.content:encoded: Juan Merchan, the judge presiding over the New York hush money trial, fined the ex-president for repeatedly violating a gag order and threatened incarceration.

item.title: Qatar's mediation efforts in Israel-Hamas war come under fire

item.content:encoded: The tiny Persian Gulf nation initially had success persuading Hamas to give up hostages. Critics claim its influence and commitment have diminished.

item.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. says he has qualified for California's presidential ballot

item.title: Regular mammograms should start at 40 as breast cancer rates rise for younger women, panel says

item.description: New recommendations from the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force say breast cancer screening should begin at 40 and continue every other year through age 74.
item.content:encoded: New recommendations from the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force say breast cancer screening should begin at 40 and continue every other year through age 74.

item.title: Will hackers, trolls and AI deepfakes upset the 2024 election?

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs seeks dismissal of revenge porn, human trafficking claims in lawsuit

item.title: More student loan forgiveness available, but April 30 deadline looms

item.content:encoded: The Biden administration's most successful effort to forgive student-loan debt will end April 30. Here's what you need to do to qualify.

item.title: Canny as a crocodile but dumber than a baboon — new research ponders T. rex's brain power
item.dc:creator: Corinne Purtill

item.content:encoded: T. rex intelligence was likely much closer to that of modern-day crocodiles than primates — a perfectly respectable amount of smarts for a therapod.

item.title: California climbers train for Mt. Everest from the comfort of their own beds

item.title: Calmes: That scowl. The gag order. Frightened jurors. Who's on trial, a former president or a mob boss?

item.content:encoded: It's downright disturbing to contemplate the similarities between the Donald's hush money trial and that of an organized crime don.

item.title: How a migrant farmworker built generational wealth, penny by penny
item.dc:creator: Xavier Martinez

item.content:encoded: My grandfather kept ledgers logging every day he worked in the U.S. The dry entries — "18 boxes of cherries, $4 per box" — tell a story of success against the odds.

item.title: Oldest living MLB player turns 100, vividly recalls facing Dodgers in 1953 World Series
item.dc:creator: Steve Henson

item.content:encoded: Signed by the Dodgers, Art Schallock won three World Series titles with the Yankees. The oldest living MLB player, now 100, counted Mickey Mantle and Yogi Berra as friends.

item.title: Pummeled by airstrikes, Ukrainians in Kharkiv live in defiance of Russia
item.dc:creator: Laura King
item.description: Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, is facing intense Russian airstrikes, but its residents are defiant. "We can stand up, no matter what they do," one said.
item.content:encoded: Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, is facing intense Russian airstrikes, but its residents are defiant. "We can stand up, no matter what they do," one said.

item.title: Trump is having a bad week. Will it matter in the election?

item.title: 'Rivers in the sky' have drenched California, yet even more extreme rains are possible
item.dc:creator: Grace Toohey
item.description: Despite considerably back-to-back rainy winters in California, new research finds the region has seen much wetter years in the last 3,000 years. Experts worry that variability, coupled with climate change, could leave the state unprepared.

item.title: How treatment of miscarriages is upending the abortion debate

item.content:encoded: New abortion restrictions after Roe vs. Wade was overturned, such as an Arizona legal ruling that effectively bans abortions there, are affecting women who miscarry.

item.title: San Diego is now the top border region for migrant arrivals

item.content:encoded: For first time in 25 years, San Diego is the top spot in the nation for migrant border crossings, surpassing Tucson.

media:content.media:description: Tijuana, Mexico, Thursday, April 25, 2024 - Hundreds of asylum seekers who used a CBP phone app to make an appointment, wait to for a scheduled interview with U.S. border agents at the San Ysidro Border Crossing. (Robert Gauthier/Los Angeles Times)
